alertRelabelConfigs.description:
Adds option to add alert_relabel_configs to avoid duplicate alerts in alertmanager
useful in H/A prometheus with different external labels but the same alerts
alertRelabelConfigs.title: alertRelabelConfigs

enabled.description: If false, alertmanager will not be installed
enabled.title: enabled

annotations.description:
Custom annotations for the PVC created by the alertmanager StatefulSet.
Useful for configuring storage provider options such as disk type, KMS encryption keys, or custom volume name
prefixes.
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description:
If true, storage will create or use a persistent volume
If false, storage will use emptyDir
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description:
Custom labels for the PVC created by the alertmanager StatefulSet.
Useful for selecting, grouping, and organizing so that they can be queried or targeted in deployments,
policies, etc.
labels.title: labels

storageClass.description:
Persistent Volume Storage Class
If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass>
If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning
If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is
set, choosing the default provisioner.
storageClass.title: storageClass

commonMetaLabels.description: Additional labels to attach to all resources
commonMetaLabels.title: commonMetaLabels

configmapReload.description:
Monitors ConfigMap changes and POSTs to a URL
Ref: https://github.com/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator/tree/main/cmd/prometheus-config-reloader

env.description: env sets environment variables to pass to the container. Can be set as name/value pairs, read from secrets or configmaps.
env.title: env

containerPort.description: config-reloader's container port for probes and metrics
containerPort.title: containerPort

containerPortName.description: config-reloader's container port name for probes and metrics
containerPortName.title: containerPortName

containerSecurityContext.description: Security context to be added to configmap-reload container
containerSecurityContext.title: containerSecurityContext

enabled.description: If false, the configmap-reload container will not be deployed
enabled.title: enabled

extraArgs.description:
Additional configmap-reload container arguments
Set to null for argumentless flags
extraArgs.title: extraArgs

digest.description: When digest is set to a non-empty value, images will be pulled by digest (regardless of tag value).
digest.title: digest

livenessProbe.description:
Settings for config-reloader's liveness probe
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/
livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

resources.description:
configmap-reload resource requests and limits
Ref: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
resources.title: resources

reloadUrl.description: URL for configmap-reload to use for reloads
reloadUrl.title: reloadUrl

configmapReload.title: configmapReload

extraManifests.description: Extra manifests to deploy as an array
extraManifests.title: extraManifests

extraScrapeConfigs.description:
extraScrapeConfigs adds additional scrape configs to prometheus.yml
must be a string so you have to add a | after extraScrapeConfigs:
example adds prometheus-blackbox-exporter scrape config
extraScrapeConfigs.title: extraScrapeConfigs

global.description: Global values are values that can be accessed from any chart or subchart by exactly the same name.
global.title: global

imagePullSecrets.description: imagePullSecrets for pulling images from a private repository
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

kube-state-metrics.description:
kube-state-metrics sub-chart configurable values
Please see https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/kube-state-metrics

enabled.description: If false, kube-state-metrics sub-chart will not be installed
enabled.title: enabled

kube-state-metrics.title: kube-state-metrics

prometheus-node-exporter.description:
prometheus-node-exporter sub-chart configurable values
Please see https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/prometheus-node-exporter

enabled.description: If false, node-exporter will not be installed
enabled.title: enabled

prometheus-node-exporter.title: prometheus-node-exporter

prometheus-pushgateway.description:
prometheus-pushgateway sub-chart configurable values
Please see https://github.com/prometheus-community/helm-charts/tree/main/charts/prometheus-pushgateway

enabled.description: If false, pushgateway will not be installed
enabled.title: enabled

prometheus-pushgateway.title: prometheus-pushgateway

ruleFiles.description: Prometheus server ConfigMap entries for rule files (allow prometheus labels interpolation)
ruleFiles.title: ruleFiles

scrapeConfigFiles.description:
Prometheus server ConfigMap entries for scrape_config_files
(allows scrape configs defined in additional files)
scrapeConfigFiles.title: scrapeConfigFiles

scrapeConfigs.description:
scrapeConfigs (map) defines Prometheus' default scrape_configs.
Each can be disabled by setting "enabled" to "false" or leaving it empty. The key sets the default "job_name".
Further scrapeConfigs can be added as new keys, these are then enabled by default.
Ref. https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#scrape_config
scrapeConfigs.title: scrapeConfigs

automountServiceAccountToken.description:
Opt out of automounting Kubernetes API credentials.
If set it will override serviceAccounts.server.automountServiceAccountToken value for ServiceAccount.
automountServiceAccountToken.title: automountServiceAccountToken

baseURL.description: External URL which can access prometheus, e.g. ingress host name
baseURL.title: baseURL

clusterRoleNameOverride.description: If set it will override prometheus.server.fullname value for ClusterRole and ClusterRoleBinding
clusterRoleNameOverride.title: clusterRoleNameOverride

configFromSecret.description:
Prometheus server configuration from a secret
Do not set both `configMapOverrideName` and `configFromSecret` simultaneously.
Use either `configMapOverrideName` or `configFromSecret`.
If `configFromSecret` is defined, a ConfigMap resource will NOT be generated.
configFromSecret.title: configFromSecret

configMapAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to ConfigMap
configMapAnnotations.title: configMapAnnotations

configMapOverrideName.title: configMapOverrideName

configPath.description: Path to a configuration file on prometheus server container FS
configPath.title: configPath

containerSecurityContext.description: Security context to be added to server container
containerSecurityContext.title: containerSecurityContext

annotations.description: Annotations to be added to daemonset
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description:
If true, use a daemonset instead of a deployment for pod management.
This allows to run prometheus agent on every node in the cluster.
enabled.title: enabled

labels.description: Labels to be added to daemonset
labels.title: labels

defaultFlagsOverride.description: defaultFlagsOverride replaces all the default flags
defaultFlagsOverride.title: defaultFlagsOverride

deploymentAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to deployment
deploymentAnnotations.title: deploymentAnnotations

dnsConfig.description: Custom DNS configuration to be added to prometheus server pods
dnsConfig.title: dnsConfig

dnsPolicy.description: When hostNetwork is enabled, this will set to ClusterFirstWithHostNet automatically
dnsPolicy.title: dnsPolicy

emptyDir.description: emptyDir volume configuration used if persistent volume is not enabled
emptyDir.title: emptyDir

enableServiceLinks.description:
EnableServiceLinks indicates whether information about services should be injected
into pod's environment variables, matching the syntax of Docker links.
enableServiceLinks.title: enableServiceLinks

env.description:
Additional server container environment variables

You specify this manually like you would a raw deployment manifest.
This means you can bind in environment variables from secrets.

e.g. static environment variable:
 - name: DEMO_GREETING
   value: "Hello from the environment"

e.g. secret environment variable:
- name: USERNAME
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: mysecret
      key: username
env.title: env

exemplars.description:
exemplars sets configuration to reference data outside of the MetricSet.
Ref. https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/#exemplars
Must be enabled via --enable-feature=exemplar-storage
exemplars.title: exemplars

extraArgs.description:
Additional Prometheus server container arguments
Set to null for argumentless flags
extraArgs.title: extraArgs

extraConfigmapLabels.description: Extra labels for Prometheus server ConfigMap (ConfigMap that holds serverFiles)
extraConfigmapLabels.title: extraConfigmapLabels

extraInitContainers.description: Additional InitContainers to initialize in the pod
extraInitContainers.title: extraInitContainers

extraSecretMounts.description:
Additional Prometheus server Secrets to mount
Defines additional mounts with secrets. Secrets must be manually created in the namespace.
extraSecretMounts.title: extraSecretMounts

fullnameOverride.description: Override the prometheus.server.fullname for all objects related to the Prometheus server
fullnameOverride.title: fullnameOverride

scrape_interval.description: How frequently to scrape targets by default
scrape_interval.title: scrape_interval

scrape_timeout.description: How long until a scrape request times out
scrape_timeout.title: scrape_timeout

hostAliases.description: hostAliases allows adding entries to /etc/hosts inside the containers
hostAliases.title: hostAliases

hostNetwork.description:
hostNetwork is required for use in managed kubernetes clusters (such as AWS EKS)
with custom CNI (such as calico),
because control-plane managed by AWS cannot communicate with pods' IP CIDR and admission webhooks are not working
hostNetwork.title: hostNetwork

digest.description: digest when set to a non-empty value, images will be pulled by digest (regardless of tag value).
digest.title: digest

pullPolicy.description: Prometheus server container image pull policy
pullPolicy.title: pullPolicy

tag.description: tag if not set appVersion field from Chart.yaml is used
tag.title: tag

enabled.description: If true, Prometheus server Ingress will be created
enabled.title: enabled

extraPaths.description: Extra paths to prepend to every host configuration. This is useful when working with annotation based services (passed through tpl).
extraPaths.title: extraPaths

hosts.description:
Prometheus server Ingress hostnames with optional path (passed through tpl)
Must be provided if Ingress is enabled
hosts.title: hosts

pathType.description: pathType determines the interpretation of the path matching
pathType.title: pathType

servicePort.description: Redirect ingress to an additional defined port on the service
servicePort.title: servicePort

tls.description:
Prometheus server Ingress TLS configuration (hosts passed through tpl)
Secrets must be manually created in the namespace
tls.title: tls

livenessProbeFailureThreshold.description: Set failure threshold for liveness probe
livenessProbeFailureThreshold.title: livenessProbeFailureThreshold

livenessProbeInitialDelay.description: Set initial delay for liveness probe
livenessProbeInitialDelay.title: livenessProbeInitialDelay

livenessProbeSuccessThreshold.description: Set success threshold for liveness probe
livenessProbeSuccessThreshold.title: livenessProbeSuccessThreshold

namespaces.description:
namespaces to include in service discovery instead of clusterwide discovery. Needed if you want to run
Prometheus without cluster-admin privileges (namespaced configuration). See also releaseNamespace.
Setting useExistingClusterRoleName is required.
namespaces.title: namespaces

nodeSelector.description:
Node labels for Prometheus server pod assignment
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/assign-pod-node/
nodeSelector.title: nodeSelector

accessModes.description:
Prometheus server data Persistent Volume access modes
Must match those of existing PV or dynamic provisioner
Ref: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes/
accessModes.title: accessModes

annotations.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume annotations
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description:
If true, Prometheus server will create/use a Persistent Volume Claim
If false, use emptyDir
enabled.title: enabled

existingClaim.description:
Prometheus server data Persistent Volume existing claim name
Requires server.persistentVolume.enabled: true
If defined, PVC must be created manually before volume will be bound
existingClaim.title: existingClaim

labels.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume labels
labels.title: labels

mountPath.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume mount root path
mountPath.title: mountPath

selector.description:
Persistent Volume Claim Selector
Useful if Persistent Volumes have been provisioned in advance
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes/#selector
selector.title: selector

size.description: Prometheus server data Persistent Volume size
size.title: size

statefulSetNameOverride.description:
If set it will override the name of the created persistent volume claim
generated by the stateful set.
statefulSetNameOverride.title: statefulSetNameOverride

storageClass.description:
Prometheus server data Persistent Volume Storage Class
If defined, storageClassName: <storageClass>
If set to "-", storageClassName: "", which disables dynamic provisioning
If undefined (the default) or set to null, no storageClassName spec is
  set, choosing the default provisioner.  (gp2 on AWS, standard on
  GKE, AWS & OpenStack)
storageClass.title: storageClass

subPath.description:
Subdirectory of Prometheus server data Persistent Volume to mount
Useful if the volume's root directory is not empty
subPath.title: subPath

volumeName.description:
Persistent Volume Name
Useful if Persistent Volumes have been provisioned in advance and you want to use a specific one
volumeName.title: volumeName

podAnnotations.description: Annotations to be added to Prometheus server pods
podAnnotations.title: podAnnotations

podAntiAffinity.description:
Pod anti-affinity can prevent the scheduler from placing Prometheus server replicas on the same node.
The value "soft" means that the scheduler should *prefer* to not schedule two replica pods onto the same node
but no guarantee is provided.
The value "hard" means that the scheduler is *required* to not schedule two replica pods onto the same node.
The default value "" will disable pod anti-affinity so that no anti-affinity rules will be configured (unless
set in `server.affinity`).
podAntiAffinity.title: podAntiAffinity

podAntiAffinityTopologyKey.description:
If anti-affinity is enabled sets the topologyKey to use for anti-affinity.
This can be changed to, for example, failure-domain.beta.kubernetes.io/zone
podAntiAffinityTopologyKey.title: podAntiAffinityTopologyKey

podLabels.description: Labels to be added to Prometheus server pods
podLabels.title: podLabels

prefixURL.description:
The URL prefix at which the container can be accessed. Useful in the case the '-web.external-url' includes a slug
so that the various internal URLs are still able to access as they are in the default case.
(Optional)
prefixURL.title: prefixURL

probeHeaders.description:
probeHeaders sets custom HTTP headers for Liveness/Readiness/Startup Probe
Useful for providing HTTP Basic Auth to healthchecks
probeHeaders.title: probeHeaders

readinessProbeFailureThreshold.description: Set failure threshold for readiness probe
readinessProbeFailureThreshold.title: readinessProbeFailureThreshold

readinessProbeInitialDelay.description: Set initial delay for readiness probe
readinessProbeInitialDelay.title: readinessProbeInitialDelay

readinessProbeSuccessThreshold.description: Set success threshold for readiness probe
readinessProbeSuccessThreshold.title: readinessProbeSuccessThreshold

releaseNamespace.description:
releaseNamespace to enable only the release namespace for service discovery.
By default all namespaces are included in service discovery.
If releaseNamespace and namespaces are both set, a merged list will be created.
Note that kubernetes_sd_configs.namespaces in scrape configs must be specified
if namespaced service discovery is desired. Setting useExistingClusterRoleName is required.
releaseNamespace.title: releaseNamespace

replicaCount.description: Use a StatefulSet if replicaCount needs to be greater than 1 (see below)
replicaCount.title: replicaCount

resources.description:
Prometheus server resource requests and limits
Ref: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/
resources.title: resources

retention.description: Prometheus data retention period (default if not specified is 15 days)
retention.title: retention

retentionSize.description: Prometheus' data retention size. Supported units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, EB.
retentionSize.title: retentionSize

revisionHistoryLimit.description:
Number of old history to retain to allow rollback
Default Kubernetes value is set to 10
revisionHistoryLimit.title: revisionHistoryLimit

route.description:
route (map) allows configuration of HTTPRoute resources
Requires Gateway API resources and suitable controller installed within the cluster
Ref. https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/guides/http-routing/

additionalRules.description: additionalRules (templated) allows adding custom rules to the route
additionalRules.title: additionalRules

annotations.description: Annotations to attach to the HTTPRoute resource
annotations.title: annotations

filters.description:
Filters define the filters that are applied to requests that match
this rule
filters.title: filters

hostnames.description:
Hostnames (templated) defines a set of hostnames that should match against the HTTP Host
header to select a HTTPRoute used to process the request
hostnames.title: hostnames

httpsRedirect.description:
httpsRedirect adds a filter for redirecting to https (HTTP 301 Moved Permanently).
To redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS, you need to have a Gateway with both HTTP and HTTPS listeners.
Matches and filters do not take effect if enabled.
Ref. https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/guides/http-redirect-rewrite/
httpsRedirect.title: httpsRedirect

kind.description: kind set by default to HTTPRoute
kind.title: kind

labels.description: Labels to attach to the HTTPRoute resource
labels.title: labels

matches.description:
Matches define conditions used for matching the rule against incoming
HTTP requests
matches.title: matches

parentRefs.description: ParentRefs refers to resources this HTTPRoute is to be attached to (Gateways)
parentRefs.title: parentRefs

route.title: route

schedulerName.description:
Use an alternate scheduler, e.g. "stork".
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/administer-cluster/configure-multiple-schedulers/
schedulerName.title: schedulerName

securityContext.description: Security context to be added to server pods
securityContext.title: securityContext

additionalPorts.description: Additional port to define in the Service
additionalPorts.title: additionalPorts

annotations.description: Annotations to be added to Service
annotations.title: annotations

clusterIP.description: Set ClusterIP for Prometheus server service
clusterIP.title: clusterIP

enabled.description: If false, no Service will be created for the Prometheus server
enabled.title: enabled

externalIPs.description:
List of IP addresses at which the Prometheus server service is available
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#external-ips
externalIPs.title: externalIPs

externalTrafficPolicy.description:
externalTrafficPolicy is applicable to service with externally-facing addresses
(NodePorts, ExternalIPs, and LoadBalancer IPs)
externalTrafficPolicy.title: externalTrafficPolicy

gRPC.description: Configure gRPC on service to allow auto discovery with thanos-querier

enabled.description: Enable gRPC port on service to allow auto discovery with thanos-querier
enabled.title: enabled

gRPC.title: gRPC

labels.description: Labels to be added to Service
labels.title: labels

loadBalancerClass.description: LoadBalancerClass for Prometheus server service (optional, cloud specific)
loadBalancerClass.title: loadBalancerClass

loadBalancerIP.description: LoadBalancerIP for Prometheus server service (optional, cloud specific)
loadBalancerIP.title: loadBalancerIP

loadBalancerSourceRanges.description: LoadBalancerSourceRanges for Prometheus server service (optional, cloud specific)
loadBalancerSourceRanges.title: loadBalancerSourceRanges

servicePort.description: Service port for Prometheus server service
servicePort.title: servicePort

sessionAffinity.description: SessionAffinity configures the affinity settings for the Service
sessionAffinity.title: sessionAffinity

statefulsetReplica.description:
If using a statefulSet (statefulSet.enabled=true), configure the
service to connect to a specific replica to have a consistent view
of the data.

enabled.description: If true, configure the service to connect to a specific replica
enabled.title: enabled

replica.description: The index of the replica to connect to (0-based)
replica.title: replica

statefulsetReplica.title: statefulsetReplica

sidecarContainers.description: sidecarContainers - add more containers to prometheus server
sidecarContainers.title: sidecarContainers

sidecarTemplateValues.description: sidecarTemplateValues - context to be used in template for sidecarContainers
sidecarTemplateValues.title: sidecarTemplateValues

failureThreshold.description: set failure threshold for startup probe
failureThreshold.title: failureThreshold

annotations.description: Annotations to be added to statefulset
annotations.title: annotations

enabled.description:
If true, use a statefulset instead of a deployment for pod management.
This allows to scale replicas to more than 1 pod
enabled.title: enabled

headless.description: Prometheus' headless service to use for the statefulset

annotations.description: Annotations to be added to headless service
annotations.title: annotations

gRPC.description: gRPC service configuration to allow auto discovery with thanos-querier

enabled.description: Enable gRPC port on service to allow auto discovery with thanos-querier
enabled.title: enabled

gRPC.title: gRPC

labels.description: Labels to be added to headless service
labels.title: labels

headless.title: headless

labels.description: Labels to be added to statefulset
labels.title: labels

pvcDeleteOnStsDelete.description:
Statefulset's persistent volume claim retention policy
pvcDeleteOnStsDelete and pvcDeleteOnStsScale determine whether
statefulset's PVCs are deleted (true) or retained (false) on scaling down
and deleting statefulset, respectively. Requires 1.27.0+.
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/statefulset/#persistentvolumeclaim-retention
Statefulset's persistent volume claim retention policy on deletion
pvcDeleteOnStsDelete.title: pvcDeleteOnStsDelete

pvcDeleteOnStsScale.description: Statefulset's persistent volume claim retention policy on scaling
pvcDeleteOnStsScale.title: pvcDeleteOnStsScale

storagePath.description:
The data directory used by prometheus to set --storage.tsdb.path
When empty server.persistentVolume.mountPath is used instead
storagePath.title: storagePath

tcpSocketProbeEnabled.description:
Prometheus server readiness and liveness probe initial delay and timeout
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/
Enable tcpSocket probe
tcpSocketProbeEnabled.title: tcpSocketProbeEnabled

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Prometheus server pod termination grace period
terminationGracePeriodSeconds.title: terminationGracePeriodSeconds

tolerations.description:
Node tolerations for server scheduling to nodes with taints
Ref: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/
tolerations.title: tolerations

useExistingClusterRoleName.description:
Name of an existing cluster role to use in a role binding in namespaces set in
namespaces and releaseNamespace for namespaced discovery.
useExistingClusterRoleName.title: useExistingClusterRoleName

enabled.description:
If true a VPA object will be created for the controller
(either StatefulSet or Deployment, based on above configs)
enabled.title: enabled

alerts.description:
groups:
  - name: Instances
    rules:
      - alert: InstanceDown
        expr: up == 0
        for: 5m
        labels:
          severity: page
        annotations:
          description: '{{ $labels.instance }} of job {{ $labels.job }} has been down for more than 5 minutes.'
          summary: 'Instance {{ $labels.instance }} down'
alerts DEPRECATED unless explicitly naming your files, please use alerting_rules.yml
alerts.title: alerts

rule_files.description: rule_files defines additional rule files to load, relative to the Prometheus configuration directory.
rule_files.title: rule_files

rules.description: rules DEPRECATED unless explicitly naming your files, please use recording_rules.yml
rules.title: rules

serviceAccounts.description: Define serviceAccount names for components. Defaults to component's fully qualified name.

automountServiceAccountToken.description:
Opt out of automounting Kubernetes API credentials.
It will be overriden by server.automountServiceAccountToken value, if set.
automountServiceAccountToken.title: automountServiceAccountToken

serviceAccounts.title: serviceAccounts
